headline: Tech analyst Dan Ives flags 10 stocks to own, insists there's no AI bubble
summary: The AI revolution is still in its early innings. Wedbush analyst Dan Ives argues that investors are misreading one of the most significant technology build-outs since the dawn of the internet.

raw.headline: Tech analyst Dan Ives flags 10 stocks to own, insists there's no AI bubble

headline: Kyndryl (KD) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of IT infrastructure services provider Kyndryl (NYSE:KD) jumped 1.7% in the afternoon session after Guggenheim initiated coverage on the company with a Buy rating and set a price target of $30. The new price target suggested a notable upside from the stock's previous closing price of $25.11. Analyst Jonathan Lee's bullish stance came as the company, which spun off from IBM in 2021, continued to implement its 'Triple A' program aimed at improving profitability and cash flow. The initiation

headline: Macquarie says AI isn’t a bubble as demand still far outstrips supply
summary: Investing.com -- Macquarie pushed back against growing investor fears of an AI bubble, arguing in a note on Wednesday that the sector is being driven by real economic returns and severe supply constraints rather than speculation.

raw.headline: Macquarie says AI isn’t a bubble as demand still far outstrips supply
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Macquarie pushed back against growing investor fears of an AI bubble, arguing in a note on Wednesday that the sector is being driven by real economic returns and severe supply constraints rather than speculation.

headline: Oppenheimer Thinks Investors Are Missing Out on IBM Stock
summary: Oppenheimer analyst believes investors are underestimating IBM’s rising strength in the AI-driven tech world.

headline: Goldman Sachs Spotlights Dividend Stocks Using AI – 5 Strong Buys Now
summary: Needless to say, over the last three years, the Artificial Intelligence explosion has been at the top of almost every investor’s mind. Many have become wealthy, as stocks like NVIDIA and other top tech names soared in a rally some feel is reminiscent of the late 1990s dot-com boom and bust. Between billions being spent ...
